episodeTitle: The Straw Hat Crew Gets Wiped Out! The Shadow-Shadow's Powers in Full Swing
episodeTitleJapanese: 壊滅、麦わら一味 カゲカゲの能力全開
episodeTitleRomanized: Kaimetsu, Mugiwara Ichimi - Kage Kage no Chikara Zenkai
description: The Straw Hats face their most devastating battle yet as Gecko Moria unleashes the full power of his Shadow-Shadow Fruit through the zombie giant Oars. Using his Shadow Revolution technique, Moria manipulates Oars' body to mimic Luffy's stretching abilities, making the zombie nearly unstoppable. Despite coordinated attacks and discovering Oars' weakness, the crew is systematically defeated one by one.

events.title: Raikotsuken: Gavotte Bond en Avant - Combined Straw Hat Attack
events.description: Brook, Usopp, Robin, and Nami execute a devastating combination attack. Usopp launches Brook through his Kuwagata slingshot, Robin spins Brook mid-air using Slalom Vine, and Nami electrifies him with her Dark Cloud Tempo. Brook becomes a lightning arrow that pierces Oars' right shoulder.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' growing ability to coordinate complex combination attacks. First major combination technique involving four crew members working in perfect synchronization.

quotes.text: Let's show them what happens when the Straw Hats work together!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Coordinating the combination attack against Oars

events.title: Shadow Revolution - Moria's Body Manipulation Technique
events.description: Gecko Moria reveals his Shadow Revolution (Kage Kakumei) technique, implanting his shadow into Oars' shadow. By manipulating the shape of Oars' shadow, Moria forces Oars' body to match that shape, giving the zombie giant the ability to stretch like rubber - effectively mimicking Luffy's Devil Fruit powers.
events.significance: Reveals the true versatility of the Kage Kage no Mi's powers beyond just stealing shadows. This technique allows Moria to grant any physical properties to his zombies by manipulating their shadows, making them far more dangerous than anticipated.

quotes.text: With my Shadow Revolution, I can change the shape of his shadow... and his body will be forced to match it! Now Oars can stretch just like Straw Hat!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Explaining how he gave Oars stretching abilities

events.title: Brook Defeated by Oars
events.description: After the combination attack, Brook is left vulnerable and is quickly defeated by Oars, who takes advantage of Brook's exposed position following the Raikotsuken technique.
events.significance: First Straw Hat to fall in this battle, marking the beginning of the crew's systematic defeat.

events.title: Robin's Ochenta Fleur: Cuatro Manos
events.description: Nico Robin unleashes her Ochenta Fleur: Cuatro Manos (Eighty Flower: Four Hands) technique, sprouting eighty arms that combine into four gigantic hands. She uses these massive hands to restrain Gecko Moria directly, attempting to stop him from manipulating Oars.
events.significance: Shows Robin's Devil Fruit powers evolving to create larger-scale constructs. Demonstrates her strategic thinking by targeting Moria instead of the seemingly invincible Oars.

events.title: Moria's Brick Bat Assault
events.description: Moria transforms his shadow Doppelman into countless shadow bats called Brick Bat. The swarm of bats attacks Robin, forcing her to defend desperately with Veinte Fleur: Calendula, but she is overwhelmed by the sheer number of shadow creatures.
events.significance: Reveals another versatile application of Moria's shadow powers - the ability to transform his shadow into multiple independent entities that can swarm opponents.

events.title: Robin's Shadow Stolen by Moria
events.description: Using his shadow doppelganger as a distraction, Moria positions himself behind Robin and steals her shadow using his Kage Kage no Mi powers. Robin immediately loses consciousness, unable to continue the battle.
events.significance: Critical turning point as another Straw Hat loses their shadow and ability to fight. Robin's loss is particularly devastating as she was one of the crew's strategic minds and was successfully targeting Moria directly.

events.title: Chopper Discovers Oars' Fatal Weakness
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper, using his medical knowledge, deduces that Oars died from frostbite 500 years ago. He realizes that while Oars feels no pain as a zombie, his right arm - the area most affected by frostbite - is severely damaged and represents a critical weak point that can still accumulate damage.
events.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's medical expertise and strategic value to the crew. Provides crucial tactical information that gives the Straw Hats a potential path to victory despite Oars' overwhelming power.

quotes.text: I figured it out! Oars died of frostbite 500 years ago! His right arm is his weak point - he can't feel pain, but he can still take damage there!
quotes.speaker: Tony Tony Chopper
quotes.context: Revealing Oars' critical weakness through medical analysis

events.title: Armée de L'Air Kokutei Roseo Shoot
events.description: Sanji and Chopper execute a combination attack called Armée de L'Air Kokutei Roseo Shoot, specifically targeting Oars' frostbitten right arm in an attempt to exploit the weakness Chopper discovered. The coordinated aerial assault aims to immobilize Oars' most dangerous weapon.
events.significance: Shows the crew's ability to quickly adapt strategy based on new information. Demonstrates growing coordination between Sanji and Chopper as they target the specific weak point identified.

events.title: Oars Uses Gomu Gomu no Gatling
events.description: Oars, now able to stretch like Luffy thanks to Moria's Shadow Revolution, unleashes a devastating Gomu Gomu no Gatling attack. The rapid-fire punches overwhelm Sanji and Chopper, defeating them both despite their attempt to target his weak point.
events.significance: Demonstrates the terrifying combination of Oars' giant strength with Luffy's signature techniques. Shows that Moria's Shadow Revolution has effectively created a monster with all of Luffy's abilities but at a massive scale.

events.title: Straw Hat Crew Decimated - Only Three Remain
events.description: By the end of the episode, the majority of the Straw Hat crew has been defeated. Brook, Robin, Sanji, Chopper, and Franky are all incapacitated. Only Nami, Zoro, and Usopp remain standing to face the combined threat of Oars and Gecko Moria.
events.significance: One of the darkest moments for the Straw Hat Pirates up to this point. The crew has never been so thoroughly defeated, with more than half their members down. Sets up desperate final battle with only three members remaining.

events.title: Oars Ball - Moria's Shadow Manipulation
events.description: Moria uses his Shadow Revolution technique to transform Oars into a massive ball shape, called the Oars Ball. By manipulating Oars' shadow into a spherical form, Oars' body is forced to match, creating a devastating rolling attack that can crush opponents.
events.significance: Further demonstrates the versatility of Shadow Revolution - Moria can transform Oars into any shape by manipulating his shadow, not just giving him stretching abilities.

events.title: Robin Focuses on Defeating the Real Moria
events.description: Despite being attacked by Moria's shadow doppelganger, Robin demonstrates tactical wisdom by focusing entirely on restraining Moria's real body. She understands that if Moria is defeated, all his shadow abilities will cease, making him the true target rather than Oars or his shadow clones.
events.significance: Highlights Robin's intelligence and strategic thinking in combat. Shows her ability to identify the core weakness in an enemy's strategy rather than being distracted by overwhelming force.

quotes.text: If I can defeat the real Moria, his shadow powers will stop!
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Focusing on Moria's real body rather than his shadow

quotes.text: With my Shadow Revolution, I can change the shape of his shadow... and his body will be forced to match it! Now Oars can stretch just like Straw Hat!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria

quotes.text: I figured it out! Oars died of frostbite 500 years ago! His right arm is his weak point - he can't feel pain, but he can still take damage there!
quotes.speaker: Tony Tony Chopper

themes.description: The episode showcases the Straw Hats' desperate struggle against overwhelming odds as they are systematically defeated one by one, yet they continue fighting and strategizing until the very end.
themes.symbolism: The gradual defeat of each crew member represents the crushing weight of Moria's power, while their continued resistance despite impossible odds embodies the crew's unbreakable spirit.

themes.description: Despite Moria and Oars' overwhelming strength, the Straw Hats use strategy, coordination, and analysis to find weaknesses and create opportunities.
themes.symbolism: Chopper's medical analysis of Oars' frostbite and Robin's strategic focus on Moria rather than Oars represent the crew's reliance on intelligence when facing superior force.

themes.description: The episode heavily features combination attacks requiring multiple crew members to coordinate perfectly, showcasing how the crew has grown to fight as a unified unit.
themes.symbolism: The four-person Raikotsuken combination and the Sanji-Chopper duo attack represent the bonds formed through their journey together.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin demonstrates tactical brilliance by targeting Moria directly rather than being distracted by Oars or shadow clones. Her defeat when Moria steals her shadow is particularly devastating given her strategic approach.
keyActions: Executes Slalom Vine as part of combination attack with Brook
Uses Ochenta Fleur: Cuatro Manos to restrain Moria

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper's medical knowledge proves crucial as he deduces Oars' cause of death and identifies his critical weakness. This showcases his value beyond just combat support.
keyActions: Analyzes Oars and discovers frostbite weakness
Coordinates with Sanji to target the weak point
Defeated by Oars' Gomu Gomu no Gatling
quotes: I figured it out! Oars died of frostbite 500 years ago!

characterSpotlights.development: Moria demonstrates the full versatility of his Kage Kage no Mi powers, showing abilities beyond simple shadow theft. His Shadow Revolution technique and tactical use of shadow clones prove devastatingly effective.
keyActions: Gives Oars stretching abilities through shadow manipulation
Uses Brick Bat to overwhelm Robin
quotes: With my Shadow Revolution, I can change the shape of his shadow... and his body will be forced to match it!

characterSpotlights.development: Brook participates in one of the most complex combination attacks seen so far, showing his integration into the crew's fighting style.
keyActions: Executes Raikotsuken: Gavotte Bond en Avant with Usopp, Robin, and Nami
Pierces Oars' shoulder with lightning-enhanced attack
First Straw Hat defeated in this battle

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded some of the battle sequences and combination attacks with additional animation details not present in the manga panels.
Animation showed blood appearing on Brook's skeleton form during battle, which is physically impossible - noted as animation inconsistency.

trivia.fact: Mayumi Tanaka and Colleen Clinkenbeard voice both Luffy and Oars in Japanese and English respectively, since Oars has Luffy's shadow.
Shadow Revolution (Kage Kakumei) works on the principle that shadows normally match the body, but Moria reverses this - forcing the body to match the shadow's shape instead.
This episode marks one of the most devastating defeats for the Straw Hat crew, with 5 out of 8 active members incapacitated by the end.
The animation showed inconsistent tooth counts for Oars across different scenes, noted as an animation error.
The Raikotsuken: Gavotte Bond en Avant is one of the first four-person combination techniques shown in the series.
Episode 371 adapts primarily manga chapters 476-477, covering the crew's desperate battle against Moria and Oars.
